한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: There is a contradiction in what he said.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: The classic Chinese paradox: a merchant claimed his spear could pierce any shield, and his shield could block any spear

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 인생의 역설은 가진 것이 많을수록 불안해진다는 것이다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: Life's paradox is that the more you have, the more anxious you become.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 역 appears in 역행(go backwards), 반역(rebellion). 설 appears in 소설(novel), 설명(explanation)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).breakdown: 고(苦) bitter/suffering + 충(衷) inner feelings
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: We listened to the hardships of office workers.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 고 appears in 고통(pain), 고생(hardship). 충 appears in 충심(sincerity), 절충(compromise)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: You must act according to your conscience.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 심 is one of the most common hanja: 심리(psychology), 관심(interest), 안심(relief), 결심(determination)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).breakdown: 소(所) that which / place + 신(信) believe/trust
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: I like people who speak with conviction.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 소 means 'that which' (abstract). 신 appears in 신뢰(trust), 신용(credit), 자신(self-confidence), 확신(certainty)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).breakdown: 파(波) wave + 급(及) reach/extend to
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: The ripple effect of this policy is significant.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 파 appears in 파도(wave), 파장(wavelength). 급 appears in 보급(supply/distribution), 언급(mention)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).english: to feel firsthand; perceived (as in 체감 온도)
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: The perceived cost of living keeps going up.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 체 appears in 체력(stamina), 신체(body). 감 appears in 감동(emotion), 감각(sense), 직감(intuition)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 이번 선거의 핵심 쟁점은 경제 문제다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: The key issue in this election is the economy.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 쟁 appears in 경쟁(competition), 논쟁(debate), 전쟁(war). 점 appears in 관점(viewpoint), 시점(point in time)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).breakdown: As 'current affairs': 시(時) time + 사(事) affairs. As 'suggest': 시(示) show + 사(唆) incite/hint
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 이 연구 결과는 중요한 점을 시사한다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: This research result suggests an important point.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: Two different words with same pronunciation. Context determines meaning

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: You need to understand the intent of this law.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 취 appears in 취미(hobby), 흥취(interest). 지 appears in 요지(gist), 본지(true meaning)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: You need to know the context to understand that.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: Think of it as 'the veins that connect things' — the underlying thread. 맥 appears in 맥박(pulse), 동맥(artery)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 이 문장에는 깊은 함축이 담겨 있다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: This sentence carries a deep implication.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: Meaning stored within — not said directly. 축 appears in 축적(accumulation), 저축(savings)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 충분한 논거 없이 주장하면 안 된다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: You shouldn't argue without sufficient grounds.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 논 appears in 논문(thesis), 논리(logic), 토론(debate). 거 appears in 근거(basis), 증거(evidence)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).breakdown: 귀(歸) return/go back to + 결(結) tie/conclude
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: In the end, we reached the same conclusion.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 귀 appears in 귀국(return to country), 귀환(return). 결 appears in 결론(conclusion), 결과(result)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).breakdown: 전(前) before/in front + 제(提) raise/put forward
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: The premise of this logic is wrong.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: What you 'put forward before' the argument. 전 appears in 이전(before), 전진(advance). 제 appears in 제안(proposal), 제출(submit)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: We are working to seek development.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 도 appears in 도표(chart), 의도(intention). 모 appears in 음모(conspiracy), 참모(advisor/strategist)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: The patterns of society are changing rapidly.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 상 is very common: 상상(imagination), 인상(impression), 상대(counterpart)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: Please take care of your health.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: Keep your mind on something. 유 appears in 유학(study abroad, 'stay + learn'). 의 appears in 의미(meaning), 의견(opinion), 주의(caution)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: We need to collect various opinions.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 수 appears in 수집(collection), 회수(retrieval), 수입(income/import)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).english: to emerge; to rise (as an issue)
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 환경 문제가 중요한 과제로 대두되고 있다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: Environmental issues are emerging as an important challenge.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: Literally 'raise one's head' — to surface. 두 appears in 두통(headache), 선두(lead/front)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).breakdown: 간(看) look + 과(過) pass by
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 사소한 문제라고 간과하면 나중에 큰 탈이 난다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: If you overlook it as a trivial problem, it'll cause big trouble later.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 간 appears in 간호(nursing/care), 간판(signboard). 과 appears in 과정(process), 통과(passing through), 초과(excess)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).english: to belittle; to look down on
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: If you belittle your opponent, you'll get burned.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 경 appears in 경솔(rash/careless), 경박(frivolous). 시 appears in 시야(field of vision), 주시(watching closely), 감시(surveillance)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: Civic groups urged the government to prepare countermeasures.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 촉 appears in 촉진(promotion/acceleration), 촉발(triggering). 구 appears in 요구(demand), 추구(pursuit), 탐구(inquiry)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).breakdown: 갈(葛) arrowroot + 등(藤) vine — tangled vines as a metaphor for entanglement
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 세대 간 갈등이 점점 심화되고 있다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: Conflict between generations is deepening.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: A beautiful metaphor: intertwined vines that cannot be easily separated. Used for interpersonal, social, and internal conflicts alike

한자어 (Sino-Korean).english: to derive; to draw out (a conclusion)
한자어 (Sino-Korean).breakdown: 도(導) lead/guide + 출(出) come out/exit
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 연구팀은 방대한 데이터에서 의미 있는 결론을 도출했다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: The research team derived meaningful conclusions from the vast data.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 도 appears in 지도(guidance), 인도(leading/guiding). 출 appears in 출발(departure), 산출(output), 제출(submission)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).english: to highlight; to bring into relief
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: The media highlighted this issue prominently.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: Like a carved figure rising to the surface. 부 appears in 부상(rising/surfacing), 부유(floating). 각 appears in 조각(sculpture), 시각(time/visual)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).english: to reject; to exclude; to ostracize
한자어 (Sino-Korean).breakdown: 배(排) push away/arrange + 척(斥) repel/denounce
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 외부 문화를 무조건 배척하는 것은 바람직하지 않다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: Unconditionally rejecting outside culture is not desirable.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 배 appears in 배제(exclusion), 배출(emission). 척 appears in 척결(eradication), 거척(rejection)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).english: to seek; to explore; to grope for
한자어 (Sino-Korean).breakdown: 모(摸) grope/feel around + 색(索) search/rope
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: Both sides are exploring common ground.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: Implies searching without a clear path. 색 appears in 수색(search/sweep), 탐색(exploration), 검색(lookup/search)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 경제 지표의 추이를 면밀히 관찰해야 한다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: We must closely observe the trend of economic indicators.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 추 appears in 추진(propulsion), 추정(estimation), 추론(inference). 이 appears in 이동(movement), 전이(transfer), 변이(mutation)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 경제 성장에는 반드시 환경 파괴가 수반되는 것은 아니다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: Economic growth does not necessarily entail environmental destruction.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 수 appears in 수행(carrying out/accompanying), 추수(harvest — following autumn). 반 appears in 동반(accompanying), 반려(life partner)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).breakdown: 여(輿) carriage/the public + 론(論) discussion/theory
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: When public opinion worsened, the government changed its position.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 여(輿) originally meant 'carriage' but came to mean 'the masses/public.' 론 appears in 이론(theory), 논론(debate), 결론(conclusion)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: The National Assembly voted on the presidential impeachment motion.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 탄 appears in 탄원(petition/plea), 탄압(oppression). A word that became widely known in Korea through the 2004 and 2016 impeachment events

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: The Board of Audit demanded rectification of budget execution.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 시(是) is the classical Chinese copula 'to be/this is right.' 정 appears in 정당(just/legitimate), 정정(correction), 공정(fairness)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).breakdown: 통(洞) cave/see through + 찰(察) examine/observe
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 이 책은 인간 본성에 대한 깊은 통찰을 담고 있다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: This book contains deep insight into human nature.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 통(洞) as in seeing through to the core. 찰 appears in 관찰(observation), 경찰(police), 감찰(inspection), 시찰(inspection tour)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 이 현상에 대한 다각적인 고찰이 필요하다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: A multifaceted examination of this phenomenon is needed.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 고 appears in 고려(consideration), 참고(reference), 사고(thinking). 찰 appears in 통찰(insight), 관찰(observation)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: Social discourse must form before policy changes.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 담 appears in 담화(conversation/address), 상담(counseling), 면담(interview). 론 appears in 이론(theory), 여론(public opinion)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 과학적 가설은 반드시 실험을 통해 검증되어야 한다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: Scientific hypotheses must be verified through experiments.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 검 appears in 검사(inspection/prosecutor), 검토(review), 점검(checkup). 증 appears in 증거(evidence), 증명(proof), 보증(guarantee)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).breakdown: 갈(渴) thirst + 망(望) hope/gaze into distance
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: The yearning for freedom exists in everyone.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 갈 appears in 갈증(thirst), 갈구(craving). 망 appears in 희망(hope), 욕망(desire), 절망(despair), 전망(outlook)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).breakdown: 자(自) self + 괴(愧) ashamed + 감(感) feeling
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: I fell into self-reproach, feeling I hadn't done my best.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 자 appears in 자아(ego/self), 자존(self-respect), 자각(self-awareness). 감 appears in 죄책감(guilt), 박탈감(sense of deprivation)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 어린 시절 정서적 결핍은 성인기에도 영향을 미친다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: Emotional deprivation in childhood affects adulthood as well.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 결 appears in 결함(defect), 결석(absence). 핍 appears in 궁핍(poverty/destitution), 핍박(persecution)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 감정을 지나치게 억압하면 결국 폭발하게 된다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: If you excessively repress your emotions, they will eventually explode.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 억 appears in 억제(restraint/inhibition), 억울(unjust/unfair). 압 appears in 압력(pressure), 압도(overwhelming), 탄압(oppression)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).breakdown: 잠(蠶) silkworm + 식(食) eat — silkworms eating leaves bit by bit
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 외래 자본이 국내 시장을 잠식하고 있다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: Foreign capital is encroaching on the domestic market.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: A vivid metaphor: silkworms consume mulberry leaves slowly but completely. 식 appears in 식량(provisions), 침식(erosion), 부식(corrosion)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).breakdown: 산(算) calculate/count + 출(出) come out/produce
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 이 공식으로 정확한 수치를 산출할 수 있다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: You can calculate precise figures using this formula.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 산 appears in 계산(calculation), 예산(budget), 산정(estimation). 출 appears in 도출(derivation), 배출(emission), 생산(production)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 장기 침체에서 벗어나려면 구조 개혁이 필수적이다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: Structural reform is essential to escape long-term stagnation.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 침 appears in 침묵(silence), 침수(flooding/submersion). 체 appears in 정체(congestion/standstill), 체류(staying/residence)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 재정 적자가 누적되면서 국가 신용도가 하락했다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: As fiscal deficits accumulated, the national credit rating fell.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 재 appears in 재산(property), 재벌(conglomerate), 재원(financial resources). 정 appears in 정치(politics), 행정(administration)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 법원이 피의자에 대한 구속 영장을 발부했다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: The court issued an arrest warrant for the suspect.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 구 appears in 구금(confinement), 구류(detention). 속 appears in 속박(bondage), 결속(solidarity/binding together), 약속(promise — lit. 'bind by agreement')

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: The defendant pleaded not guilty.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 항 appears in 항의(protest), 저항(resistance), 대항(opposition). 변 appears in 변론(oral argument), 변호(defense), 답변(reply)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 대법원 판례에 따르면 이 행위는 위법이다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: According to Supreme Court precedent, this act is illegal.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 판 appears in 판결(verdict), 판단(judgment), 재판(trial). 례 appears in 사례(case/example), 관례(custom/convention), 전례(precedent)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: The Constitutional Court dismissed the unconstitutionality lawsuit.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 기 appears in 폐기(disposal/abolishment), 유기(abandonment), 포기(giving up). 각 appears in 퇴각(retreat), 각하(dismissal, honorific also 'Your Excellency')

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 문제의 본질을 파악하지 못하면 해결책도 나오지 않는다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: If you cannot grasp the essence of the problem, no solution will emerge either.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 본 appears in 기본(basics), 본래(originally), 근본(foundation). 질 appears in 성질(nature/temperament), 자질(qualities/aptitude), 물질(matter/substance)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: Philosophy is a process of ceaseless contemplation.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 사 appears in 사고(thinking), 사색(meditation), 사상(ideology). Not to be confused with 사유(私有) meaning 'private ownership' — same pronunciation, different hanja

한자어 (Sino-Korean).breakdown: 성(省) reflect/examine oneself + 찰(察) observe/inspect
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: True growth begins with self-reflection.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 성(省) appears in 반성(self-reflection/repentance), 성찰 is a deeper, more philosophical form of 반성. 찰 appears in 관찰(observation), 통찰(insight)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: The virus is mutating rapidly.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 변 appears in 변화(change), 변동(fluctuation), 돌변(sudden change). 이 appears in 이질(heterogeneous), 이상(abnormal), 경이(wonder/marvel)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 기술과 예술의 융합이 새로운 산업을 창출하고 있다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: The fusion of technology and art is creating new industries.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 융 appears in 금융(finance — lit. 'melt gold/money'), 융통(flexibility/accommodation). 합 appears in 통합(integration), 합의(agreement), 결합(combination)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: The observatory is observing the asteroid's orbit.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 관 appears in 관찰(observation), 관람(viewing), 관점(viewpoint). 측 appears in 측정(measurement), 예측(prediction), 추측(speculation)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).breakdown: 쇄(刷) brush/sweep clean + 신(新) new
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 조직 쇄신 없이는 경쟁력을 유지할 수 없다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: Without organizational reform, competitiveness cannot be maintained.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: Literally 'brush clean and make new.' 쇄 appears in 인쇄(printing). 신 appears in 혁신(innovation), 신규(new/fresh), 갱신(renewal)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).english: to dismiss flatly; to reject outright
한자어 (Sino-Korean).breakdown: 일(一) one + 축(蹴) kick — to reject with a single kick
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 정부 대변인은 그 보도를 사실무근이라며 일축했다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: The government spokesperson flatly dismissed the report as groundless.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: A vivid image: kicking something away in one motion. Often used in news/political contexts for emphatic denial or rejection

한자어 (Sino-Korean).english: to dispel; to wipe away (doubts, concerns)
한자어 (Sino-Korean).breakdown: 불(拂) brush off + 식(拭) wipe/clean
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 국민의 불안을 불식시키기 위한 대책이 시급하다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: Measures to dispel public anxiety are urgently needed.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 불(拂) as in brushing away dust. 식 appears in 식별 is a different 식(識). Commonly paired with 우려(concerns) or 의혹(suspicions)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example: 소득 격차가 벌어지면 사회 불안이 커진다.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: When the income gap widens, social unrest grows.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 격 appears in 격리(isolation/quarantine), 간격(interval/spacing). 차 appears in 차이(difference), 차별(discrimination), 오차(margin of error)

한자어 (Sino-Korean).example_en: Consumer sentiment froze due to the economic contraction.
한자어 (Sino-Korean).notes: 위 appears in 위축 only commonly. 축 appears in 축소(reduction/downsizing), 압축(compression), 수축(contraction). Also used psychologically: 기가 위축되다 (to feel intimidated)

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
아쉽다 = regretful (situation-focused, 'what a shame')
서운하다 = hurt/disappointed (person-focused, feeling let down by someone)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 시간이 없어서 아쉽다. / 연락도 없이 가서 서운했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: It's a shame there's no time. / I was hurt that you left without contacting me.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
부럽다 = envious (benign, admiring)
질투하다 = jealous (more negative, possessive)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 네가 부럽다. / 친구의 성공에 질투를 느꼈다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I envy you. / I felt jealous of my friend's success.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
무섭다 = scary (immediate, visceral fear)
두렵다 = fearful/daunting (deeper, more abstract fear)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 귀신이 무섭다. / 미래가 두렵다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Ghosts are scary. / The future is daunting.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
고치다 = fix/repair (broken things, bad habits)
수정하다 = revise/amend (documents, plans)
보완하다 = supplement/shore up (fill gaps)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 버릇을 고치다 / 계획을 수정하다 / 부족한 점을 보완하다
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Fix a habit / Revise a plan / Shore up weak points

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
결국 = in the end (neutral/negative outcome)
마침내 = at last (after long effort, literary)
드디어 = finally! (excitement, long-awaited)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 결국 실패했다. / 마침내 정상에 도착했다. / 드디어 졸업이다!
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: In the end, it failed. / At last, we reached the summit. / Finally, graduation!

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
차라리 = rather/I'd rather (choosing lesser evil)
오히려 = on the contrary; rather (unexpected reversal)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 이럴 바에야 차라리 안 할래. / 도와주려다가 오히려 방해가 됐다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: If it's like this, I'd rather not. / I tried to help but rather got in the way.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
내세우다 = to put forward / champion (a person, cause, principle)
주장하다 = to argue / claim (an opinion or position)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 그를 후보로 내세웠다. / 자기 의견을 강하게 주장했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: They put him forward as a candidate. / He argued his opinion strongly.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
눈치 = social awareness; reading people (interpersonal)
분위기 = atmosphere; mood; vibe (of a place or situation)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 눈치가 빨라서 바로 알아챘다. / 분위기가 좋은 카페다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: He's perceptive so he caught on right away. / It's a cafe with a good vibe.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
삼가다 = to refrain from (respectful/formal, often warnings)
자제하다 = to restrain oneself (self-control focused)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 음주를 삼가세요. / 감정을 자제해야 한다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Please refrain from drinking. / You need to restrain your emotions.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
헤아리다 = to fathom/empathize (emotional, deeper understanding)
파악하다 = to grasp/assess (analytical, factual understanding)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 남의 마음을 헤아리다. / 상황을 정확히 파악하다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: To fathom someone's feelings. / To accurately grasp the situation.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
익숙하다 = familiar through habit/practice (skill-based)
친숙하다 = familiar in a warm/friendly way (comfort-based)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 이 길은 익숙하다. / 친숙한 얼굴을 보니 반갑다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I'm used to this road. / It's nice to see a familiar face.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
참다 = hold back (immediate impulse — anger, tears, laughter)
견디다 = endure/withstand (prolonged hardship)
인내하다 = persevere with patience (formal, virtue-like)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 웃음을 참았다. / 추위를 견디다. / 인내하면 반드시 결과가 온다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I held back laughter. / Endure the cold. / If you persevere, results will come.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
미루다 = put off/procrastinate (casual, often laziness)
연기하다 = postpone (official/formal, with reason)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 공부를 내일로 미뤘다. / 행사가 우천으로 연기되었다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I put off studying until tomorrow. / The event was postponed due to rain.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
탓하다 = blame (general, can be self or others)
비난하다 = criticize/condemn (stronger, public, moral judgment)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 남 탓하지 마. / 언론이 정부를 비난했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Don't blame others. / The media condemned the government.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
빠지다 = fall into / get sucked in (often unintentional)
몰두하다 = immerse oneself (deliberate, deep focus)
열중하다 = be engrossed/enthusiastic (active engagement)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 게임에 빠졌다. / 연구에 몰두하다. / 독서에 열중하다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Got sucked into gaming. / Immersed in research. / Engrossed in reading.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
꺼리다 = be reluctant/hesitant about (personal discomfort)
기피하다 = avoid/shun (deliberate avoidance, stronger)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 남 앞에서 말하기를 꺼린다. / 병역을 기피하다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I'm reluctant to speak in front of others. / To evade military service.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
물러나다 = step back/withdraw (general, any context)
사퇴하다 = resign under pressure (public figures, implies scandal/failure)
사임하다 = resign (neutral/formal, voluntary)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 한 발 물러나다. / 장관이 사퇴했다. / 건강상의 이유로 사임했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Step back one pace. / The minister resigned (under pressure). / Resigned for health reasons.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
따지다 = question/nitpick (confrontational, demanding accountability)
캐묻다 = pry/dig into (nosy, invasive questioning)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 잘잘못을 따지다. / 사생활을 캐묻다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: To question who's right and wrong. / To pry into someone's private life.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
시달리다 = be plagued/tormented (ongoing, wearing you down)
시련을 겪다 = go through a trial/ordeal (discrete event, builds character)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 불면증에 시달리다. / 큰 시련을 겪고 성장했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: To be plagued by insomnia. / Grew through a great ordeal.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
그르치다 = to spoil/ruin (lead astray, esp. a person's path)
망치다 = to mess up/wreck (broader, any situation)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 아이의 교육을 그르치다. / 발표를 완전히 망쳤다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: To ruin a child's upbringing. / Completely messed up the presentation.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
바라다 = hope/wish (warm, personal, often for others)
원하다 = want (direct, personal desire)
희망하다 = hope for (formal, often for larger outcomes)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 행복하길 바란다. / 나는 자유를 원한다. / 평화를 희망합니다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I hope you're happy. / I want freedom. / We hope for peace.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
알리다 = let someone know/inform (personal, direct)
공개하다 = disclose/make public (reveal what was hidden)
발표하다 = announce/present (official, to an audience)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 부모님께 소식을 알렸다. / 수사 결과를 공개했다. / 연구 결과를 발표했다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Informed my parents of the news. / Disclosed investigation results. / Presented research findings.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
내키다 = to feel like it (motivation/willingness from within)
마음이 끌리다 = to be drawn to (attraction, pulled toward something)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 오늘은 운동이 내키지 않는다. / 그 사람한테 마음이 끌린다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: I don't feel like exercising today. / I'm drawn to that person.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
꾸미다 = to decorate/make up (general — room, appearance, story)
치장하다 = to dress up/adorn (specifically appearance, often excessive)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 방을 예쁘게 꾸몄다. / 화려하게 치장하고 나타났다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: Decorated the room prettily. / Showed up dressed to the nines.

뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).english:
심하다 = severe/extreme (degree of intensity)
지나치다 = excessive/going too far (crossing a line)
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example: 감기가 심하다. / 농담이 지나쳤다.
뉘앙스 & 유의어 (Nuance & Synonyms).example_en: The cold is severe. / The joke went too far.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to be merely; nothing more than
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: This is merely the beginning.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: regardless of
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: You can apply regardless of gender.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: based on; grounded in
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: You must judge based on facts.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: equivalent to; on par with
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Receiving treatment on par with full-time employees.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: starting with; led by
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Officials attended, led by the president.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to be absorbed in; devoted entirely to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: He is entirely absorbed in research.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to recall; to be reminded of
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It's time to recall our original intentions.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to be attributable to; to originate from
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: This problem is attributable to a lack of communication.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to be reminiscent of; to rival
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It was a scene reminiscent of a battlefield.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to contribute to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I want to contribute to the development of society.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: due to; because of (formal cause)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Roads are being restricted due to heavy rain.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: in light of; considering
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 과거 사례에 비추어 볼 때 이번에도 같은 결과가 예상된다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: In light of past cases, the same result is expected this time.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: prior to; before (formal)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Prior to the meeting, there will be a brief greeting.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: regardless of; irrespective of
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Regardless of ideology, people's livelihoods come first.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: owing to; on account of (very formal/literary)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Owing to his mistake, the project was delayed.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: ranging to; extending up to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Everyone participated, from children to the elderly.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: is nothing other than; is precisely
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 이것은 국민에 대한 배신에 다름 아니다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: This is nothing other than a betrayal of the people.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: is nothing more than; merely
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: That's nothing more than an excuse.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: to reach the point of; to come to
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: It eventually reached the point of bankruptcy.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: not only... but also (written/formal)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Not only is their skill outstanding, but their character is excellent too.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: it's a good thing that...; fortunately (otherwise...)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 빨리 발견할 망정이지 늦었으면 큰일 날 뻔했다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Good thing it was discovered quickly — any later and it would have been a disaster.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: I would say that; in my humble opinion (very formal/literary)
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 생각건대 이 문제는 쉽게 해결되지 않을 것이다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: In my estimation, this problem will not be easily resolved.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: consider it as; treat it as if
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: Let's do it, considering it as gaining experience.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: not stopping at; going beyond just
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example: 단순한 비판에 그치지 않고 대안을 제시해야 한다.
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: You shouldn't stop at mere criticism — you need to present alternatives.

격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).english: can only; all one can do is; merely
격식 & 문어체 (Formal & Written).example_en: I can only be grateful.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Like talking to a wall (lit. 'reading sutras to a cow's ear')
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 우(牛) cow + 이(耳) ear + 독(讀) read + 경(經) sutra/scripture
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: No matter what I say, it's like talking to a wall.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: You reap what you sow (lit. 'your own doing, your own reward')
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 자(自) self + 업(業) deed/karma + 자(自) self + 득(得) obtain
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: That's what you get (you brought it on yourself).

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: To give up on oneself; to abandon all hope
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 자(自) self + 포(暴) be violent/reckless + 자(自) self + 기(棄) abandon/discard
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Don't give up on yourself — let's try again.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Sharing joys and sorrows together
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 동(同) together + 고(苦) suffering + 동(同) together + 락(樂) joy/pleasure
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: They're colleagues who shared joys and sorrows for 10 years.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Killing two birds with one stone
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 일(一) one + 석(石) stone + 이(二) two + 조(鳥) bird
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Exercise and stress relief — two birds with one stone.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Preparedness prevents disaster
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 유(有) have + 비(備) preparation + 무(無) without + 환(患) worry/disaster
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 유비무환이라고, 미리 준비해 두는 게 낫다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: As they say, preparedness averts disaster — better to prepare in advance.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Turning misfortune into fortune; a blessing in disguise
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 전(轉) turn + 화(禍) misfortune + 위(爲) become + 복(福) fortune/blessing
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Losing my job actually turned into a blessing in disguise.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Same bed, different dreams (outwardly together but thinking differently)
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 동(同) same + 상(床) bed + 이(異) different + 몽(夢) dream
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: They sat at the negotiating table, but were actually dreaming different dreams.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Things will eventually right themselves; justice prevails in the end
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 사(事) matter/affair + 필(必) necessarily + 귀(歸) return + 정(正) righteous/correct
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: As they say, things right themselves — the truth will come out.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Heart-to-heart understanding; unspoken mutual understanding
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 이(以) by means of + 심(心) heart + 전(傳) transmit + 심(心) heart
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Even without words, we understand each other heart to heart.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: After hardship comes sweetness; no pain, no gain
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 고(苦) bitter + 진(盡) exhaust/end + 감(甘) sweet + 래(來) come
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: They say sweetness follows bitterness — good days have finally come.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Unforgettable gratitude; deeply engraved in one's bones
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 각(刻) carve + 골(骨) bone + 난(難) difficult + 망(忘) forget
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: My benefactor's help is something I can never forget.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: The more the better
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 다(多) many + 다(多) many + 익(益) benefit + 선(善) good
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: When it comes to experience, the more the better.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A ragtag group; disorganized mob
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 오(烏) crow + 합(合) gather + 지(之) 's (possessive) + 졸(卒) soldiers
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: That team is a disorganized mob with no strategy.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Crows gathering chaotically — no formation, no leader

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Lost in fog; completely in the dark
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 오(五) five + 리(里) ri (distance unit) + 무(霧) fog + 중(中) middle
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: The truth of the case is still completely in the dark.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Can't sit still; on pins and needles
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 좌(坐) sit + 불(不) not + 안(安) comfortable + 석(席) seat
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Waiting for the results, I was on pins and needles.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Blindly following the crowd; joining without thinking
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 부(附) attach + 화(和) harmonize + 뇌(雷) thunder + 동(同) same
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Don't just blindly follow — have your own opinion.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: Like echoing thunder mindlessly — agreeing without understanding

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: A lesson from others' mistakes; learning from someone else's example
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 타(他) other + 산(山) mountain + 지(之) 's + 석(石) stone
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example: 그 회사의 실패를 타산지석으로 삼아야 한다.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: We should take that company's failure as a lesson.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: A stone from another mountain can polish your jade — others' failures teach you

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Seeing something awakens desire; tempted by what you see
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 견(見) see + 물(物) thing + 생(生) arise + 심(心) heart/desire
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: Seeing delicious food awakens my appetite.

사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).english: Achievement through extreme diligence (studying by firefly/snow light)
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).breakdown: 형(螢) firefly + 설(雪) snow + 지(之) 's + 공(功) merit/effort
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).example_en: His success is the result of tireless diligence.
사자성어 (Four-Character Idioms).notes: From stories of scholars too poor for candles — one read by firefly light, another by snow's reflection

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Things keep getting harder (lit. 'the further you go, the bigger the mountain')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: I tried to resolve it but things just keep getting harder.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: The tail wagging the dog (lit. 'the belly button is bigger than the belly')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: The repair cost is more than the thing itself.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be generous (lit. 'big hands') — esp. with food/hosting
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 우리 엄마는 손이 커서 항상 많이 해.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: My mom is generous so she always makes a lot.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 그 사람은 발이 넓어서 어디든 아는 사람이 있다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: He's so well-connected that he knows someone everywhere.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Not even enough to notice (of food — still hungry)
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 이거 먹어도 간에 기별도 안 간다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Even after eating this, I don't feel a thing.
The kid is a picky eater so it's hard to feed them.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To bear a heavy burden/responsibility (lit. 'heavy shoulders')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Now that I'm team lead, the weight on my shoulders is heavy.
If you fall out of your boss's favor, things get tough.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To have high standards / be picky (lit. 'high eyes')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 눈이 높아서 아직 결혼을 못 했다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Their standards are so high they haven't married yet.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Easily swayed by others' opinions (lit. 'thin ears')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 귀가 얇아서 남 말에 잘 넘어간다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: He's easily influenced and falls for what others say.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 코가 높아서 남을 무시하는 경향이 있다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: They're arrogant and tend to look down on others.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Words become reality; be careful what you say
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 말이 씨가 된다고, 부정적인 말은 하지 마.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: They say words become seeds — don't say negative things.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: To be stabbed in the back; betrayed unexpectedly
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: I got stabbed in the back by a colleague I trusted.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: A piece of cake; extremely easy (lit. 'eating cold porridge')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Something like this is a piece of cake.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: A matter of extreme urgency (lit. 'fire on the top of your foot')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: The deadline is tomorrow — it's a five-alarm fire.

관용어 (Korean Idioms).english: Nearly impossible (lit. 'picking stars from the sky')
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example: 서울에서 집 사기는 하늘의 별 따기다.
관용어 (Korean Idioms).example_en: Buying a house in Seoul is next to impossible.
